intro: Bubon tenuifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bubon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Bubon tenuifolium thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
